start:
You don't look very sick to me.
You better not be trying to stay home
and play your Nintendo all day.

We've been through this enough.
You can stay home if you're running
a fever. A case of the sniffles
isn't going to keep you at home.

Well, you have the thermometer.
Hold it on your forehead.

Come on now, you'll need to
leave for school soon.

Ok. Keep it there while I fix lunch
for you and your brother.

And no funny business.
That thermometer better be on
your head when I turn around.

I'm not going to turn around until
that thermometer is on your head.
